summary: An abstract neural‑network layer that implements separable convolution by first applying a depthwise convolution independently on each input channel and then a pointwise convolution to combine the resulting features. It supports configurable kernel size, stride, padding, dilation, data format, activation, bias addition, and various initializers, regularizers and constraints.
business_intent: Provide a reusable, configurable component for building efficient deep‑learning models that require channel‑wise processing followed by channel mixing, reducing parameter count and computational cost compared to standard convolutions.
